field.description: Biosource label defined at the study level. To be used here only when no samples are defined at the study level.

Samples represent major outputs resulting from a protocol application. It should be either the first column containing sample names from the study file (if samples defined there), or should be preceeded by Source Name column otherwise.

Name (or URI) of the file containing definitions of phenotypic traits measured in this assay. Each row of TDF contains a trait definition in the form: Trait Name, Term Source REF, Term Accession Number, Method Name, Term Source REF, Term Accession Number, Scale Name, Term Source REF, Term Accession Number. Trait names are used in Data Files in names of data columns.
Name (or URI) of the raw data file generated by an assay. No format restrictions.

Name (or URI) of the derived data file generated from raw data by data processing. The file should be in the form of a 'Samples x Traits' matrix, where traits (i.e. columns) correspond to trait names (i.e. rows) from Trait Definition File. There is one column for each trait with continuous measurement (Trait value[<Trait Name>]) and three columns for each categorical trait (Trait value[<Trait Name>], Term Source Ref, Term Accession Number).
